thread.title: Sir Howard Davies blasts Gatwick boss
thread.title_full: Sir Howard Davies blasts Gatwick boss

title: Sir Howard Davies blasts Gatwick boss
text:
Save 
The head of the Airports Commission has blasted the boss of Gatwick, slamming Stuart Wingate’s attempt to reverse the recommendation to expand Heathrow as doing “him and his company no credit”. 
Sir Howard Davies issued the strongly worded statement on Wednesday, in response to the south London airport’s dossier published earlier this week, the Telegraph reported. 
Gatwick chief executive Stuart Wingate had claimed there were “omissions or superficial analysis in some critical areas” of the Commission’s report to the government, which addressed Britain’s capacity crisis. 
Davies hit back, stating: “This dossier appears to repeat many points which Gatwick made to the Commission in the course of its work and which, unsurprisingly, were carefully considered. 
“They did not alter the Commission’s view that Heathrow was the best option. Using colourful language, as Mr Wingate has done, does not turn weak points into strong ones, and does him and his company no credit.” 
Gatwick did not return a call requesting comment.
